clear.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: expressed in a simple and direct way so that people understand
clear.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: clear instructions
The question wasn’t very clear.
It’s the clearest guide I’ve used.
How can you make the meaning clearer?
Perhaps I tried to cover too much and didn’t make myself clear (=express myself well).
If you don’t understand, it’s best to say so and get things clear.
If I catch you smoking again, you’re grounded. Do I make myself clear? (=used when you are angry)
He writes crystal clear (=very easy to understand) prose.
Can I make it absolutely clear that we did not intend this to happen?
absolutely/abundantly clear
The report gave a clear picture of the property’s condition.
clear picture/idea
The school is clear about its policy on bullying.
clear about
Be very clear about what jobs should be completed, and by when.
clear about what/when/how etc
The rules are quite clear on the point.
clear on
It was clear to him that Tolkien was a literary genius.
clear to
The bishop made his views clear in a letter to the publisher.
make something clear
Make it clear that you will not take sides.
make it clear that
clear.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: impossible to doubt, question, or make a mistake about
clear.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: They won by a clear majority.
a clear case of sexual discrimination
It’s not clear whether he shares her views.
It’s clear that the drug does benefit some patients.
When it became clear that I was pregnant, he left me.
clear.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: feeling certain that you know or understand something
clear.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Let me get this clear – you hadn’t seen her in three days?
a clearer understanding of the issues
Are you all clear now about what you have to do?
I’m still not really clear how this machine works.
clear.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: able to think sensibly and quickly
clear.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: She felt that her thinking was clearer now.
In the morning, with a clear head, she’d tackle the problem.
clear.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: easy to see through, rather than coloured or dirty
clear.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: clean and fresh, without clouds or mist
clear.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: The skies were clear and blue.
clear.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: healthy, very pure in colour, and without any redness
clear.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: smooth and without any red spots
clear.translation[0].definitions[8].defi: having details, edges, lines etc that are easy to see, or shapes that are easy to recognize
clear.translation[0].definitions[8].exam: a TV with a clear picture and high-quality sound
clear.translation[0].definitions[9].defi: easy to hear, and therefore easy to understand
clear.translation[0].definitions[9].exam: The radio reception isn’t very clear.
It’s a good recording; the sound is as clear as a bell (=very clear).
clear.translation[0].definitions[10].def: a clear amount of profit, wages etc is what is left after taxes have been paid on it
clear.translation[0].definitions[10].exa: Sam makes a clear $90,000 per year.
clear.translation[0].definitions[11].def: without any planned activities or events
clear.translation[0].definitions[11].exa: Next Monday is clear; how about ten o'clock?
clear.translation[0].definitions[12].exa: Allow three clear days for delivery.
clear.translation[0].definitions[13].def: not covered or blocked by anything that stops you from doing or seeing what you want
clear.translation[0].definitions[13].exa: The roads were fairly clear this morning.
From the top floor you get a clear view of the bay.
To prevent fires, the sides of the roads are kept clear of underbrush.
clear.translation[0].note_box[0].section: make something clear
Children may have difficulty in making their feelings clear.
get something clear
I was trying to get the idea clear in my mind.
absolutely/perfectly clear
His answer was perfectly clear.
crystal clear
The instructions on the packet are crystal clear.
abundantly clear
By July the scale of the problem had become abundantly clear.
not entirely clear
Sam’s reasons for leaving were not entirely clear.
a clear picture/idea
Some work experience should give you a clear idea of what the job involves.
make it clear that
The tone of her voice made it clear that she was very angry.
make yourself clear
Please tell me if I’m not making myself clear.
be far from clear/be by no means clear
The directions she gave me were far from clear.
clear.translation[0].note_box[1].section: easy to see through
easy to see through, rather than coloured or dirty
The table top is a piece of clear glass.
a clear liquid
The water was so clear that you could see down to the bottom of the lake.
transparent
clear – used especially about materials and solid things. Transparent is a little more formal than clear
Fill a transparent plastic bottle with water.
a piece of transparent film
Melt 2 ounces of butter in a large frying pan, and cook the onions until they are almost transparent.
see-through
made of a very thin material that you can see through – used especially about women’s clothes
She wore a black see-through dress.
limpid
clear – used especially about water or other liquids . This is a very formal word which is used in novels and literature
limpid pools
She gave her a golden flask of limpid olive oil.
difficult to see through
opaque
difficult to see through
The shower has an opaque glass door.
clear.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to make somewhere emptier or tidier by removing things from it
clear.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Snowplows have been out clearing the roads.
Dad cleared a space (=moved things so there was room) in the garage for Jim’s tools.
It’s Kelly’s turn to clear the table (=remove the dirty plates, forks etc).
Large areas of land had been cleared of forest.
Workers began clearing wreckage from the tracks.
clear.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to make people, cars etc leave a place
clear.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Within minutes, police had cleared the area.
Crowds of demonstrators were cleared from the streets.
clear.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to prove that someone is not guilty of something
clear.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Rawlings was cleared after new evidence was produced.
a long-running legal battle to clear his name
clear.translation[1].definitions[2].note: Clear is often passive in this meaning
clear.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to give or get official permission for something to be done
clear.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: He was cleared by doctors to resume skating in August.
Defence policies must often be cleared with NATO allies first.
clear.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: to give official permission for a person, ship, or aircraft to enter or leave a country
clear.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: The plane took off as soon as it was cleared.
clear.translation[1].definitions[5].defi: if the weather, sky, mist etc clears, it becomes better and there is more sun
clear.translation[1].definitions[5].exam: The haze usually clears by lunchtime.
clear.translation[1].definitions[6].defi: if a liquid clears, it becomes more transparent and you can see through it
clear.translation[1].definitions[6].exam: Wait for the water to clear before adding any fish.
clear.translation[1].definitions[7].defi: if a cheque clears, or if a bank clears it, the bank allows the money to be paid into the account of the person whose name is on the cheque
clear.translation[1].definitions[8].defi: to go over a fence, wall etc without touching it, or to go past or through something and no longer be in it
clear.translation[1].definitions[8].exam: The plane barely cleared the fence at the end of the runway.
Edwards cleared 18 feet in the pole vault.
clear.translation[1].definitions[9].defi: if your face or expression clears, you stop looking worried or angry
clear.translation[1].definitions[9].exam: She looked embarrassed, but then her face cleared.
clear.translation[1].definitions[10].def: if your skin clears, red marks on it disappear
clear.translation[1].definitions[11].def: to earn a particular amount of money after taxes have been paid on it
clear.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: away from something, or out of the way
clear.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Firefighters pulled her clear of the wreckage.
Please stand clear of the doors.
clear.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: used to emphasize a long distance
clear.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: You can see clear to the hills.
clear.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: to give permission for a product to be sold or for a deal to be made
clear.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: The drug has been cleared by the Food and Drug Administration.
Venezuela’s congress cleared the sale of the state telephone company CANTV.
clear.translation[4].definitions[1].defi: to make payments relating to trading on financial markets or trading of goods
clear.translation[4].definitions[1].exam: About 1,000 small brokerage firms are using the company to clear and settle their trades.
It takes ages for the banks here to clear transactions and it’s very expensive.
clear.translation[4].definitions[2].defi: if a bank clears a cheque, or if a cheque clears, the money is sent from one bank to another and the cheque is paid
clear.translation[4].definitions[2].exam: The fraud relied on managers returning money before the original cheque had cleared.
clear.translation[4].definitions[3].defi: to be allowed to take things through CUSTOMS
clear.translation[4].definitions[3].exam: Bribery is needed to get goods cleared through customs.
They cleared customs, but never boarded their flight.
clear.translation[4].definitions[4].defi: to pay a debt in full
clear.translation[4].definitions[4].exam: The Ivory Coast cleared its debts of $42m.
clear.translation[4].definitions[5].defi: to earn a particular amount of money, or to make a particular amount of profit
clear.translation[4].definitions[6].defi: to sell goods cheaply in order to get rid of them
clear.translation[4].definitions[6].exam: We need to clear the old stock before we can bring in this season’s range of products.
